Reviews.Title: “Good relaxing stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ultimatelime
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my husband and I stayed at this hotel in Amsterdam. Lovely clean place, with friendly staff who gave good advice on where to eat and how to get there. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality and excellent service at this small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KDJ73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days combining business and pleasure. The staff were very welcoming and helped resolve a few work and travel issues making the whole experience far more relaxing. Not central but a quiet location that still allows you to access the city centre easily. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value (for Amsterdam!) and very nice people”
Reviews.Author: Grumpy1962
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here (25-27 September 2011) following some very poor treatment at another Amsterdam hotel. The room was comfy and clean. We had a large attic room and while I would not say it was the best accomodation I have ever stayed in, (I am fussy) I would happily stay again. We really enjoyed hiring bikes at the hotel; cycling through Vondel Park into the centre of the city and we are NOT cyclists. We would recomend this hotel and location to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LizCheshireUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a beautiful location - just on the egde of Vondelpark which meant walking to Leidesplein was beautiful - unless it was raining of course. As previously mentioned rooms are a little on the small side for the price, breakfast although very cheap at 12.00 Euros - wasn't brilliant. A stroll into town and breakfast at the Irish Pub will set you up for the day. Friendly reception staff throughout the stay and nothing too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and very friendly boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chris17phillips
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice area but a little way outside central Amsterdam.but a tram is nearby which goes straight into town. The rooms are well appointed but a bit on the small side. Breakfast is good and the staff are really friendly. It backs on to lake and is very picturesque. A nice pace to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: k2snobordr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last weekend (September 2011) for two nights. It was our first time in Amsterdam, and so we weren't sure about which parts of town were convenient for tourists - it turns out the King's Villa was perfect for us. It's a 10-minute tram ride (Number 2 line) from the touristy areas, where you can find museums, restaurants, shopping, etc. Just get off at the Valeriusplein stop, walk three blocks, and there's the hotel. Very convenient! The hotel itself is a renovated mansion that backs up to the Vondel Park. It's very comfy and cozy inside, with a very pretty stained glass window as you walk up the staircase to your room (there's also a tiny elevator, but if you're a claustrophobe like, you'll appreciate that you can take stairs up to your room). The hotel staff during our check-in/check-out were all very friendly and spoke excellent English. Our room was a "superior double room" (room 116) and it was a fair size by American standards and HUGE by European standards. Very comfy king size bed, flat screen TV with several English programs, small smoker's balcony off the bedroom and another off the bathroom. The only reason I gave this hotel four stars instead of five is because the bathroom is a bit outdated and the breakfast downstairs is overpriced (12 Euros/person). But my wife wanted me to mention that the bathroom had very nice shampoo, conditioner, etc because "that's the type of stuff women care about". So there you go, ladies. Nice shampoo that made me feel pretty. If you want a good (and cheaper) breakfast option, I'd recommend Bagels and Beans at Koningsplein 20 (Number 2 tram line from the hotel to Koningsplein). We sat in the window and a had a great view of one of the canals on a rainy morning for half the price of breakfast at the hotel). Maximum quaintness. All things considered, it turns out this was a really good option for us in a great location. We were able to enjoy all the tourist attractions in Amsterdam, and at the end of the night we were happy to be in a hotel that was a short tram ride away from the rowdiness.

Reviews.Title: “so lovely for comming back again”
Reviews.Author: m0bin
Reviews.Content: we had a family trip to amsterdam,it was so nice ,staff were very kind and helpful,the place of hotel is very quite and nice and near to a great vandle park,the complete place for rest and to be far from city noise.i sure that if i comming back to amsterdam in future i will go directly to kings villa hotel

Reviews.Title: “flaws made up for by location and back yard”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled_girl3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at King's villa 2 times and we really enjoy it. it is right on Vondel Park in a very attractive neighborood. it has an amazing back area. The bed is soft and comfortable. it's nice to have the rooms with the small balconies. Nespresso in the rooms. The carpets are shag and stained ( both times and rooms we stayed ) and a few other flaws but still all is made up for by the coziness and the location. bonus, dogs are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous loft room with the large bathtub...”
Reviews.Author: Mlarnold
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous loft room with the large bathtub was amazing! Beautiful mansion turned to hotel in a decent location if you plan on being home before 1 am as that's when the latest train drops off. Otherwise it is too far to walk from the town center and a taxi is out of the question. Soo expensive!

HotelInfo.Name: King's Villa Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Koningslaan 64, Amsterdam 1075 AG, The Netherlands
